categories.description: I am the Lord your God. You shall not have strange gods before me.

sins.question: Have I neglected regular prayer or treated my relationship with God as unimportant?
sins.confessionalFormat: I have neglected regular prayer and my relationship with God
sins.details: Prayer is essential for spiritual growth and sustaining a living relationship with God.

sins.question: Have I denied or doubted God's existence?
sins.confessionalFormat: I have denied or deliberately doubted the existence of God
sins.details: Atheism and deliberate doubt about God's existence contradict the virtue of faith.

sins.question: Have I doubted, denied, or deliberately rejected the truths of the Catholic faith?
sins.confessionalFormat: I have deliberately rejected truths of the Catholic faith
sins.details: Deliberately rejecting Church teachings or dogmas is a serious offense against faith.

sins.question: Have I engaged in superstition, fortune-telling, horoscopes, occult practices, witchcraft, spiritism, or New Age rituals?
sins.details: These practices reject trust in God's providence and can open one to spiritual harm.

sins.question: Have I despaired of God's mercy or presumed upon it without sincere repentance?
sins.details: Despair denies God's mercy; presumption abuses it.

sins.question: Have I placed ultimate trust in myself, wealth, popularity, power, or other created things rather than in God?
sins.details: Idolatry includes giving primary devotion or trust to created realities.

categories.description: You shall not take the name of the Lord your God in vain.

sins.question: Have I used God's name carelessly, irreverently, or in anger?
sins.details: The name of the Lord must be spoken with reverence.

sins.question: Have I spoken blasphemy against God, His saints, the Church, or sacred things?
sins.details: Blasphemy is a direct offense against God's honor.

sins.question: Have I made false oaths or broken vows or promises made in God's name?
sins.details: Oaths invoke God as witness to truth and must be kept.

categories.description: Remember to keep holy the Lord's Day.

sins.question: Have I deliberately missed Mass on Sundays or Holy Days without a serious reason?
sins.details: The Sunday obligation binds under pain of mortal sin.

sins.question: Have I engaged in unnecessary work that hindered worship, family time, or rest?
sins.details: Sunday is a day for worship, family, and rest.

sins.question: Have I neglected to sanctify Sunday through prayer, Scripture, or works of charity?
sins.details: The Lord's Day is a time to deepen one's spiritual life.

categories.description: Honor your father and your mother.

sins.question: Have I disobeyed, disrespected, or neglected my parents or lawful authority?
sins.details: We owe respect, gratitude, and reasonable obedience to parents and just authority.

sins.question: Have I failed to care for or support my parents in their needs?
sins.details: Adult children must honor and support their parents.

sins.question: Have I failed to foster peace, respect, and mutual support within my family?
sins.details: Family life should be marked by charity and mutual assistance.

sins.question: Have I harbored deliberate hatred or fostered anger and resentment?
sins.details: Hatred is contrary to charity and can be gravely sinful.

sins.question: Have I caused physical harm, emotional abuse, or scandal to others?
sins.details: Deliberate harm violates the dignity of the human person.

sins.question: Have I participated in, supported, or encouraged abortion, euthanasia, or assisted suicide?
sins.details: Directly taking innocent human life is gravely sinful.

sins.question: Have I recklessly endangered my life or the lives of others through substance abuse, neglect, or violence?
sins.details: We must care for our health and avoid reckless endangerment.

sins.question: Have I engaged in sexual activity outside of marriage?
sins.details: Sexual intimacy is reserved for marriage.

sins.question: Have I committed masturbation?
sins.details: Self-gratification is gravely contrary to chastity.

sins.question: Have I viewed pornography or sought impure content?
sins.details: Pornography corrupts chastity and degrades persons.

sins.question: Have I deliberately entertained lustful thoughts or fantasies?
sins.details: Willfully dwelling on lust violates purity of heart.

sins.question: Have I used contraception or undergone sterilization to prevent conception?
sins.details: Artificial prevention of conception is gravely sinful.

sins.question: Have I engaged in immodest behavior or dress that tempted others?
sins.details: Modesty safeguards purity and respect for persons.

sins.question: Have I taken or withheld what belongs to another?
sins.details: Theft and unjust withholding violate justice.

sins.question: Have I cheated in school, work, or games?
sins.details: Cheating is unjust and dishonest.

sins.question: Have I failed to pay debts or just wages?
sins.details: Failing to pay what is owed is a grave sin against justice.

sins.question: Have I wasted or misused time, resources, or property entrusted to me?
sins.details: We must respect and care for the goods of others.

categories.description: You shall not bear false witness.

sins.question: Have I lied or deceived others?
sins.details: Lying damages trust and truthfulness.

sins.question: Have I damaged another's reputation through detraction, gossip, or calumny?
sins.details: Speaking unjustly about others, whether truthfully without cause or falsely, can be gravely sinful.

sins.question: Have I failed to defend the good name of others when able?
sins.details: Charity sometimes requires defending another's reputation.

categories.description: You shall not covet your neighbor's wife.

sins.question: Have I entertained sexual desire for someone not my spouse?
sins.details: Lustful desire for another violates interior chastity.

sins.question: Have I sought out situations or images of sexual temptation?
sins.details: Avoiding near occasions of sin is a moral duty.

categories.description: You shall not covet your neighbor's goods.

sins.question: Have I been envious, jealous, or greedy for another's possessions or success?
sins.details: Envy damages our relationship with God and neighbor.

sins.question: Have I been ungrateful for my own blessings?
sins.details: Ingratitude reflects a lack of trust in God's providence.

categories.description: The minimum requirements for practicing the faith.

sins.question: Have I failed to attend Mass on Sundays or Holy Days without serious reason?
sins.details: Missing Mass without just cause is gravely sinful.

sins.question: Have I neglected to confess serious sins at least once a year?
sins.details: Annual confession of mortal sins is required.

sins.question: Have I failed to receive Holy Communion during the Easter Season?
sins.details: The Easter duty is a minimum obligation.

sins.question: Have I neglected the required days of fasting and abstinence?
sins.details: Penance is part of the Christian life.

sins.question: Have I failed to support the Church according to my means?
sins.details: The faithful have a duty to contribute to the Church's needs.
